title: Brecon Bike & Hike
suitableFor: Experienced mountain bikers and hikers with a good level of fitness who enjoy challenging trails and varied terrain. Confident navigating in potentially exposed conditions.
notSuitableFor: Beginner cyclists or hikers, those with limited fitness, or anyone uncomfortable with heights or changeable weather conditions. Also not ideal for families with young children.
packingEssentials: Hiking boots with good ankle support

stops.title: BikePark Wales - Full Day Riding
stops.description: Spend the day tackling the varied trails at BikePark Wales, from flowy blues to challenging black runs. Lift pass required.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe & Skills Area
wetAlt.description: Enjoy the cafe and covered skills area to hone your technique before venturing out when the rain subsides.

budgetAlt.title: Taff Trail Exploration
budgetAlt.description: Ride a section of the Taff Trail, a mostly flat, traffic-free path.

stops.title: BikePark Wales Cafe
stops.description: Refuel with burgers and hot food in BikePark Wales cafe with great views of the mountain.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at BikePark Wales picnic area
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own food and enjoy the park's picnic area.

stops.title: Twin Trails B&B
stops.description: A cyclist-friendly B&B located close to BikePark Wales. Offers secure bike storage and hearty breakfasts.
stops.travelToNext: 45min drive to Storey Arms Car Park

budgetAlt.title: Grawen Camping
budgetAlt.description: A campsite near BikePark Wales, offering basic facilities and a budget-friendly option.

stops.title: Pen y Fan Hike (via Storey Arms)
stops.description: Hike to the summit of Pen y Fan, the highest peak in South Wales. Expect a challenging but rewarding climb with panoramic views.

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy scenic views of the Brecon Beacons from a vintage steam train, a relaxing alternative to hiking.

budgetAlt.title: Lower-Level Walking near Pont ar Daf
budgetAlt.description: Explore the gentler trails around Pont ar Daf car park, avoiding the exposed summit.

stops.title: The Red Dragon Tea Room
stops.description: Cosy tea room in Brecon town centre serving sandwiches, cakes, and hot drinks.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Pen y Fan summit
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic with spectacular views.

stops.title: Waterfall Country Gorge Walking
stops.description: Explore the stunning waterfalls of Waterfall Country with a guided gorge walking experience, scrambling up rivers and jumping into pools.

wetAlt.title: Craig y Nos Castle Tour
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic Craig y Nos Castle, with its opera house and fascinating history.

budgetAlt.title: Self-Guided Waterfall Walk
budgetAlt.description: Explore a smaller waterfall on your own, like Sgwd Gwladus (Lady Falls).

stops.title: Craig y Nos Castle
stops.description: A historic castle offering comfortable rooms and beautiful grounds, perfect for a relaxing evening.

budgetAlt.title: Waterfall Country Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A campsite close to Waterfall Country, offering a budget-friendly overnight option.

stops.title: Taff Trail Cycling (Talybont-on-Usk)
stops.description: Cycle a scenic section of the Taff Trail, starting from Talybont-on-Usk and enjoying the canal-side views.

wetAlt.title: Brecon Cathedral Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic Brecon Cathedral, a peaceful and architecturally impressive building.

budgetAlt.title: Taff Trail Walking
budgetAlt.description: Walk along a section of the Taff Trail instead of cycling.

stops.title: The White Swan Inn (Llangorse)
stops.description: Traditional pub in Llangorse, serving hearty pub fare and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch by the canal
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic at Llangorse Lake

stops.title: Paddle Boarding at Llangorse Lake
stops.description: Enjoy a relaxing paddle boarding session on Llangorse Lake, surrounded by stunning scenery.

wetAlt.title: Llangorse Multi Activity Centre
wetAlt.description: Llangorse Multi Activity Centre is close by offering a variety of indoors activities.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llangorse Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk around the lake, taking in the views.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Brecon Beacons weather is notoriously unpredictable. Be prepared for all conditions, even in summer. Mountain weather can change rapidly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season (summer weekends and bank holidays). Parking at popular spots like Pen y Fan and Waterfall Country can be challenging â€“ arrive early or consider public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: BikePark Wales lift passes and coaching sessions should be booked in advance, especially during peak season. Guided gorge walking experiences also require advance booking. Accommodation can fill up quickly, so book well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary requires a good level of fitness. The Pen y Fan hike is strenuous, and the mountain biking at BikePark Wales involves steep climbs and technical descents.
